title: How to Play Pocket Aces in Texas Hold'em Poker

steps.headline: Maintain your poker face after reading your cards.
steps.description: Don't do a double-take, or laugh, or smile, or play a smokescreen by frowning. All you need to do is remain neutral. Look at your chips, or even think about what you had for breakfast yesterday. This way no one will guess you have pocket rockets (A-A).

steps.headline: Play the right bet.
steps.description: If you are big/small blind, you might like to just call if someone raised before you. If you are the first to bet, just call the big blind, or if you want, you can raise by a small portion (eg. If it is 4 to call, bet 6 or 8). Don't push all in, or bet something like 5 times the blind. Put in as many raises as possible, especially if you are out of position. Never re-raise pre-flop.

steps.headline: Call all you need within reason.
steps.description: If someone goes all in preflop, you should call them. Let some people get out, and then win that money back over time. That's how pros play.

steps.headline: Read the flop.
Now raise on the flop if no apparent danger is present.
steps.description: If the river shows there are 4 cards in a row, be wary of the small raise. Play likewise for suited cards (of which you have none). Play a small raise here.

steps.headline: Read the river.
steps.description: If this doesn't give you 3 aces, be wary of a large raise. If you are looking good though, raise the raise. If they then raise, just call.

steps.headline: Show the cards...mysteriously.
steps.description: If you win the hand, allow yourself a small smile, but don't gloat. If you lose, keep thinking about yesterday's breakfast. Don't let them get an idea of how you react.

steps.headline: Congratulate the player next to you.
steps.description: And say good game. People will play worse when you mess with them.
